page.title: 03Industry on the Humber Bank
page.content: The whole of tis area is{dominated by {industry.}Once an area of drained marsh used for farming is now mainly industry. Land cover is either being used by industry at the moment or is waiting for industrial development in the future. The main industries are connected with{oil refining,transport {or storage.}The advantages of the area for these industries are that they are close to the{deep water port}of Immingham for{importing petroleum,}the land is fairly{flat and cheap because {of its marshy nature}and there are now {good road and rail links}with other parts of Britain. A list of industries would include ;Lindsey Oil Refinery, Texaco Calor Gas Storage, Petrofina, Humber Sea and Land Services, various transport firms and a large area of undeveloped land owned by the C.E.G.B.
